title: Two life terms for man who raped young girls in Northern Cape
text:
South Africa Two life terms for man who raped young girls in Northern Cape 13 June 2024 - 23:01 By TimesLIVE Just R20 for the first month. Support independent journalism by subscribing to our digital news package. Subscribe now The man raped the children aged seven and eight when their mother left them with him to look for their elder brother.
Image: 123RF/Andreypopov
A 32-year-old man who raped two children six years ago has been sentenced to two life terms.
The man, who cannot be named to protect the girls who were aged seven and eight, was sentenced by the Postmasburg regional court after finding him guilty on two counts of rape. The man was living with the children and their mother in Danielskuil near Postmasburg.
The case emanates from an incident in 2018 when the mother of the two girls left the man with her children as she went looking for their elder brother who had allegedly been stabbed, National Prosecuting Authority spokesperson Mojalefa Senokoatsane said.
The man went to their mother's bedroom where they were sleeping and raped them.
They reported the incident to their aunt, who immediately informed their mother. The man was arrested and charged.
“During the trial, the two children were able to point out the accused in court. They demonstrated the way the accused had covered their mouth with his hand when they cried and detailed the pain they felt when he was raping them.”
After the state closed its case, the defence also closed its case without calling the man to testify.
In sentencing, the court was satisfied with the evidence by the state witnesses including the medical evidence.

title: Severe Weather Halts Buses and Ferries in Trøndelag and Nordvestlandet
text:
Storm battered Trondheim and Trøndelag : Challenging road conditions and poor mobility
A storm with strong winds overnight into Thursday left challenging driving conditions and impeded mobility in Trondheim and Trøndelag. In response to the difficult conditions, most bus services in Trøndelag south of Steinkjer have been suspended until further notice, according to the regional public transport provider AtB.
The operating status is uncertain, and it remains unknown when services will resume.
Orange alert issued for heavy snowfall
Meteorologisk Institutt has issued an orange alert for heavy snowfall in Møre og Romsdal and parts of Trøndelag and Sogn og Fjordane. Some areas may receive between 30 and 50 centimeters (12 to 20 inches) of snow.
"Both drivers and buses are struggling to get to work and out on the road," said AtB director Grethe Opsal in a press release, according to Adresseavisen. Consequently, all bus services have been temporarily suspended.
Snow clearance at Bakke Bru in Trondheim after an orange alert was issued for heavy snowfall in Møre og Romsdal, parts of Sogn og Fjordane, and southern Trøndelag. Photo: Jan Langhaug / NTB
Cancelled and disrupted services
Several bus and ferry routes in Møre og Romsdal have been cancelled or disrupted due to weather conditions, according to Fram’s website.
Routes 903, 232, and 250 have been cancelled, while routes 901 and 905 are experiencing delays. Ferries 1051, 1070, 1058, 1053, 1061, and 1051 have also been suspended.

title: Mahmud Jeans DMD beaten by workers amid demands for arrears | The Business Standard
text: The son of the owner and deputy managing director of Mahmud Jeans Ltd, Rafee Mahmud, was beaten yesterday (28 November) by the factory's workers, who have been demanding their outstanding salaries. Rafee, who is also the vice-president of Bangladesh Apparel Youth Leaders Association (Bayla), in a statement to members of Bayla today (29 November) said, "They [workers] tried to murder me yesterday. I couldn't even speak for two minutes before the mob started attacking from all around." "Later I was dragged and slammed under the flyover and was assaulted by big bricks, metal rod and tree branches. As soon as I got hit on the back of my head I fainted for a while. "Later when I became conscious, I felt them grabbing my neck suffocating me and dragging me into my factory and later they locked me inside," added his statement. Yesterday, workers of Mahmud Jeans Limited in Gazipur's Kaliakoir staged a demonstration blocking the Dhaka-Tangail highway all day, demanding their due wages. The blockade began at 9am today (28 November) causing traffic congestion stretching several kilometres on both sides. However, at around 8pm, the blockade was lifted on one side of the highway easing the congestion. Police and workers said the protest erupted over unpaid dues, including one month's outstanding wages for workers, service benefits, and delayed salaries of six to nine months for some factory officials. The workers further said in August, they had to stage a prolonged demonstration for unpaid wages, which had accumulated to five months at that time. Although the owners settled some payments then, dues for some workers remained. According to sources, Rafee Mahmud has been trying to sell property to pay the dues. He went to the factory yesterday evening to discuss the workers' dues that is when he was attacked. In the message to Bayla members Rafee Mahmud also said his mobile phone and all his belongings were stolen. "Dear brothers and sisters we need to make a strong statement, if we don't stand up immediately we will lose our control over our employees and workers," he added. "It was pre planned and thankfully I got proof of conversation they made in their group. I pray for all of us and the industry, we are all unsafe," he said.

author: TTV
title: 用遊戲啟動學習力！兒童遊戲團體課助孩子快樂成長
text:
2025.06.12 15:00 「遊戲」是孩子最自然、也最關鍵的學習方式。臺北市立聯合醫院兒童發展評估療育中心長期致力於學齡前兒童的早期療育，近年特別規劃由職能治療師帶領的「兒童遊戲團體課」，透過精心設計的遊戲活動，引導發展遲緩或有特殊需求的幼兒學會玩、樂於玩，進而提升日常生活與社會互動的整體發展。
科學證實：遊戲是發展關鍵 臺北市立聯合醫院中興院區兒童發展評估療育中心心智科吳貞瑩主任 指出， 遊戲不只是孩子的娛樂時間，更是促進認知、語言、動作與情緒發展的重要媒介。根據美國兒科醫學會 2007 年發表的研究指出，遊戲能有效幫助兒童提升多元能力，並強化社交互動技巧。但在臨床實務中發現，許多發展遲緩或自閉症類群障礙（ ASD ）兒童，因社交互動與遊戲技巧不足，常錯失與他人一起遊戲的機會，影響發展歷程。
職能治療師帶領，讓遊戲更有策略也更好玩 「兒童遊戲團體課」專為學齡前幼兒設計，透過職能治療師帶領，結合富有結構與變化的遊戲情境（如 123 木頭人、鬼抓人等），讓孩子在有趣、安全的環境中學習輪流、等待、表達、協調與合作等遊戲技巧。課程採漸進式設計，從簡單遊戲逐步導入角色扮演與團體互動，讓孩子不只「會玩」，更能「玩得投入、玩得開心」。
家長一起加入，學習自然延伸到生活中 課程特別安排家長觀課與分享交流，幫助家長了解孩子的表現與進步，也學會如何在日常生活中陪伴孩子延續遊戲經驗。中心主任吳貞瑩表示，許多家長回饋孩子在參加課程後，更願意與同儕互動，也會主動邀請同學一起玩在課堂中學到的遊戲，促進正向人際關係，並從中培養自信與成就感。
遊戲就是目標，結合動機創造潛力 課程理念強調：「遊戲本身就是學習的目標。」與其強迫孩子學習技能，不如從孩子的內在興趣出發，營造讓孩子「想參與、會參與」的遊戲情境。當孩子在遊戲中獲得樂趣，參與意願自然提升，也更能激發潛在的發展動能。
奠定生活參與基礎，陪孩子一起快樂長大 吳貞瑩表示，透過遊戲團體課，孩子學會的不只是技巧，更建立起日後參與團體、與人互動、融入社會的基礎。中心團隊期待這樣的課程能讓更多家庭看見「遊戲的價值」，用玩樂的方式陪伴孩子快樂邁向成長之路。
(記者 李政純，圖片來源：Dreamstime/典匠影像）

author: Susan Campbell
title: ‘I just want to cry’: Woman fights over $200K in medical bills after someone stole her identity
text:
PHOENIX ( KPHO /Gray News) - A Phoenix woman says someone has stolen her identity and has charged thousands of dollars’ worth of medical care in her name.
“The bills are outrageous. I get a new bill every day, and I just want to cry,” Jennifer O’Connor said. “For just the surgery, it was $217,000.”
O’Connor thumbed through a stack of papers, including other bills for $32,000 and $9,300.
She says she has lost track of the total.
“I’m getting bills from CT scans, bills from anesthesiologists, different doctors that she saw at the hospital. It’s just overwhelming,” O’Connor said. “She used my insurance at Banner because I have Banner insurance. At HonorHealth, she did not use insurance, so she just gave them my information and said, ‘I don’t have insurance.’”
O’Connor said the first sign of a problem was when she received a bill from an anesthesiologist.
“Twenty-four hundred dollars for anesthesia, and I’m like, anesthesia? When did I go under anesthesia?” she said. “I looked more into it, and all I had to do to get into it was put in my date of birth, and bam. There’s the bill.”
The real O’Connor is a respiratory therapist at a Banner facility. Her supervisor submitted a letter to their employer to prove the real Jennifer O’Connor was on the clock when the imposter O’Connor was getting medical care.
“I just know I was working my butt off and I wasn’t getting screws in my legs and on fentanyl, that’s for sure,” she said. “It wasn’t me. None of this was me.”
Still, the paper trail and the police reports that O’Connor filed with area authorities have not been enough to unravel the mess.
“I get two emails from Banner saying they’re going to garnish my wages for a visit at Banner Boswell ER for $150, and a $36 bill from Banner Desert,” O’Connor said. “They just sent it to collections.”
If it sounds like a nightmare, it is. But O’Connor is not alone.
“It is getting easier and easier to obtain the data of a legitimate person and then create the fake identity,” Eva Velasquez, the president and CEO of the non-profit Identity Theft Resource Center, said. “When it comes to medical identity theft, it does get tricky because we don’t have a central repository for all of our medical records, so I encourage people to focus their energy on just protecting their identity, on the whole.”
According to the FBI’s Internet Crimes Complaint Center, reports for identity theft are declining, year-over-year, in both the number of complaints and the amount of money lost.
Still, it remains critical to take preventative steps to protect your identity.
Agents suggest unique passwords for all accounts, as well as multi-factor authentication.
The FBI says it is also important to protect physical documents with personal information. That includes securing your mailbox.
If you become a victim of medical identity theft, keep meticulous records.
“The unfortunate reality is that you must resolve this directly with the entity where the fraud occurred,” Velasquez said. “Call back as often as you feel comfortable doing, asking, ‘What is the status of this? What do you need from me to prove that I am me and did not receive this care, these goods, or this prescription?’ And then, unfortunately, the onus is often on you, the victim, to supply that information, to do your own investigation and build that case.”
While medical identity theft can be costly, it has serious health concerns.
“You potentially now have mixed medical records with the thief, and you could get improper care and an improper diagnosis,” Velasquez said. “You could also not have the ability to get necessary prescriptions filled or to get access to necessary medical equipment because the thief has already gotten those things in your name.”
That’s what the real Jennifer O’Connor fears the most.
“All her medical stuff is on file. Not mine,” she said. “If I was in a car accident on the way home, God forbid, and I was out of it and needed blood products, I could die because she probably doesn’t have the same blood type as me, and that terrifies me.”
Representatives with HonorHealth and Banner have not immediately responded to questions regarding O’Connor’s case or the companies’ medical identity theft policies.
The Mesa Police Department said it has not identified any suspects, and the case is currently inactive.
Phoenix police and the Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office say investigations remain open regarding O’Connor’s situation with evidence still being collected.

title: A plane falls to San Paolo, Brase; They report two dead
text:
Tragic Plane Crash in São Paulo: A detailed Overview A Devastating Morning in São Paulo On a fateful Friday morning, São Paulo, brazil, was shaken by a tragic plane crash that claimed two lives adn injured several others. The incident occurred on a bustling avenue in the city, drawing immediate attention from local emergency services.
The Incident A small aircraft, reportedly a King bimotor with a capacity for eight passengers, met with disaster shortly after takeoff. The plane, which had departed from a nearby airport catering to small aircraft, lost altitude and crashed into a public bus.The collision ignited a fire, as captured in distressing footage by the Globo television network. The visuals also showed a severely injured individual being rushed to an ambulance.
Emergency Response The São Paulo Fire Brigade was speedy to respond, battling the flames at the crash site. According to Guilherme Derce, the Secretary of State Security for São Paulo, the firefighters successfully extinguished the fire. The accident led to the closure of Avenida marquês de São Vicente,a major road west of São Paulo,near the airport from which the plane had taken off.
Casualties and Injuries The crash resulted in the deaths of two individuals: the pilot and a passenger. Captain Ronaldo Melo of the local fire brigade confirmed these fatalities.Additionally,six peopel sustained injuries.Five of these were at a nearby bus stop,while the sixth was a motorcyclist who happened to be passing by at the time of the crash.
Community and Government Response São Paulo’s Mayor, Ricardo Nunes, expressed his condolences and assured that all city council resources were mobilized to assist the victims. The community rallied together in the aftermath,highlighting the resilience and solidarity of São Paulo’s residents.
Broader Context This incident underscores the ongoing challenges and risks associated with air travel, particularly in urban areas. It serves as a stark reminder of the importance of stringent safety measures and emergency preparedness.
For those interested in further developments,stay tuned for updates on this and other related incidents.
Tragic Plane Crash in San Paolo, Brase: Two Lives Lost incident Overview A devastating plane crash occurred in San Paolo, Brase, claiming the lives of two individuals. The tragic event took place near the outskirts of the city, prompting a swift emergency response from local authorities and aviation experts. This article provides complete details about the plane crash, including eyewitness accounts, emergency response efforts, and ongoing investigations.
Details of the crash The incident occurred early morning, with the plane reportedly struggling for lift before losing altitude rapidly. Initial reports suggest ther may have been mechanical failure, though investigations are ongoing to establish the definitive cause. Here are some critical details regarding the crash:
Time and Location: The crash took place at approximately 6:15 AM local time near a residential area on the outskirts of San Paolo, Brase. Flight Details: Details regarding the flight number,airline,and route is currently under investigation,with authorities aiming for a swift identification and disclosure. Passenger Count: Official reports confirm two crew members on board, both of whom tragically lost their lives. The aircraft was unconfirmed to have any passengers. Emergency Response and Rescue Efforts The emergency teams, including paramedics, firefighters, and local law enforcement, were deployed promptly upon receiving the distress signals. The swift action led to prompt on-site management of the situation. Here’s how the rescue operations unfolded:
Firefighters extinguished the flames rapidly to avoid further damage and risk to nearby residential areas. Paramedics treated the area, verifying the unfortunate loss of life while ensuring no additional casualties. Forensic teams were engaged to secure the crash site for a thorough investigation. Investigation and Findings A comprehensive investigation has been initiated to determine the cause of the crash. Experts from the aviation industry are collaborating with local authorities to gather evidence and analyze flight data recorders. Preliminary findings point towards potential mechanical issues, but a detailed report is awaited.
Investigation Aspect Status Mechanical failure Under Investigation Pilot Error Possibility Being Explored Weather Conditions Absence of Adverse Conditions Reported Witness Accounts and Eyewitnesses Residents in the vicinity provided valuable first-hand accounts of the accident. Their descriptions paint a picture of the sequence of events that led to the crash, highlighting the urgency felt as the plane spun out of control. Some witnesses noted hearing an alarm before the crash.
John Doe: “I heard a loud sound before seeing the smoke. it was terrifying. Everyone was in shock.” Jane Smith: “I saw the plane descending rapidly. The emergency response was speedy, but there was nothing that could have been done.” Impact on the Community The crash has left a lasting impact on the San Paolo community. Efforts are in place to provide support to affected families and residents. Counseling services have been mobilized to help those impacted physically and emotionally by the tragedy.
Local authorities have also initiated safety briefing sessions to reassure the public about air travel safety and steps being undertaken to prevent future incidents.
Aviation Safety and Prevention Measures Following this tragedy, there has been a renewed focus on aviation safety, especially around aircraft maintenance and pre-flight inspections. Experts and industry bodies are emphasizing the importance of rigorous checks and adherence to safety protocols.
Some measures being considered include:
Enhancing pilot training programs to better handle emergency situations. Implementing advanced technology for real-time monitoring of aircraft health. Increasing frequency of comprehensive maintenance checks and audits. Government and Industry Response in response to the crash, both government bodies and the aviation industry have pledged to review and strengthen existing safety frameworks. Key commitments include:
collaboration with international aviation regulatory agencies to align with global best practices. Mobilizing a task force to oversee the implementation of recommended safety measures. Increased funding for technological upgrades and pilot training. what you Need to know As investigations continue, it is crucial for residents and aviation enthusiasts to stay informed about the latest updates.
